subject: @AfterClass is poorly defined
msgSnippet: It would be way more useful if this annotation could be applied to a non-static method.  The same could be said for @BeforeClass but at least you can put code
messageBody:
It would be way more useful if this annotation could be applied to a
non-static method. The same could be said for @BeforeClass but at
least you can put code you would have put in @BeforeClass in the
constructor. Even the javadocs agree with my suggestion:

http://junit.org/junit/javadoc/4.5/org/junit/AfterClass.html

the example given won't even compile -- this example shows the
functionality I want but can't get because @AfterClass can only be
applied to static methods. If this annotaton cannot be changed to
accept non-static fields, new annotations should be created to provide
such functionality.

Here is the code given in the example that accompanies the AferClass
javadoc with minimal modifications to almost get it to compile. Copy
and paste into your IDE and try to compile this code:

import org.junit.AfterClass;
import org.junit.BeforeClass;
import org.junit.Test;

public class Example {
DatabaseConnection database;
@BeforeClass public static void login() {
database = null;
}
@Test public void something() {
}
@Test public void somethingElse() {
}
@AfterClass public static void logout() {
database.logout();
}
}

class DatabaseConnection {

public void logout() {}
}

As stated earlier, the example as given is very useful but won't compile.
